newsitem.title: SOUTH KOREA: Strike halts car output at Daewoo Bupyong plant.
newsitem.headline: Strike halts car output at Daewoo Bupyong plant.

text.p: Assembly lines stopped in South Korean Daewoo Motor's plant at Bupyong on Wednesday as unionised workers went on strike, a company spokesman said.
The union calls for a 9.7 percent rise in basic salary payments for this year, while the management is offering a 5.45 percent increase.

"We could not narrow differences yesterday as management made no gestures to accommodate our demands and we walked out from a meeting. We don't have any plan to talk to the management today," the union member said.
The company spokesman said the one-day strike would cost Daewoo Motor 1,600-1,700 vehicles in lost production.
